metadata.specialization: A1N, Second cycle, has only first-cycle course/s as entry requirements

sections.Confirmation: This course syllabus was confirmed by The IT Faculty Board on 2011-12-02 to be valid from 2012-09-03.
sections.Position in the educational system:
The course is a part of the Computer Science Master's Programme and an elective
course at the Univeristy of Gothenburg
The course can be part of the following programmes: 1) Computer Science, Master's
Programme (N2COS), 2) Computer Science, Bachelor's Programme (N1COS) and 3)
No translation available (NDATM)
sections.Entry requirements:
The requirement for the course is to have successfully completed two years within the
subject Computer Science or equivalent. The course DIT230 Programming languages
technology or equivalent, is required.
sections.Learning outcomes:
After completion of the course the student is expected to be able to:
Knowledge and understanding
make informed choices about the design and use of advanced programming
language technology.
Skills and abilities
critically evaluate new programming languages and tools effectively assimilate and
summarise advanced research material,
deliver effective and clear presentations of highly technical programming language
research.
Judgement and approach
identify the frontiers of research in the area of programming languages.
sections.Course content:
The course runs throughout the whole academic year, with regular seminars and
discussions, occasional exercises, and a finishing with presentations of project work.
Participants usually deliver several short presentations during the course, including
presentations about programming languages, research papers from recent top
conferences in programming language technology, and their own project work.
sections.Assessment:
The course is examined on basis of the project done in a group or individually and on
the individual performance in presentations, discussions and exercises.
A student who has failed the same examination twice has the right to request of the
department a change of examiner. The request is to be in writing and submitted as soon
as possible. The department is to grant such a request without delay.
In cases where a course has been discontinued or major changes have been made a
student should be guaranteed at least three examination occasions (including the
ordinary examination occasion) during a time of at least one year from the last time the
course was given.
sections.Grades:
The grading scale comprises: Fail (U), Pass (G), Pass with Distinction (VG).
To Pass the course the participant must have a good attendance record, and achieve a
satisfactory performance in the presentation and project components of the course. In
determining whether a Pass with Distinction (VG) will be awarded around 50% of the
final grade is determined by the project component, and 50% on the performance in the
other presentations.
sections.Course evaluation:
The course is evaluated through meetings both during and after the course between
teachers and student representatives. Further, an anonymous questionnaire is used to
ensure written information. The outcome of the evaluations serves to improve the
course by indicating which parts could be added, improved, changed or removed.
sections.Additional information: It is recommended but not required, to read DIT300 compiler construction beforehand.
